description_list: Supreme Court of Justice that admitted a 2019 recurs, scheduled admissibility hearing, and ruled on acceleration.|||0.99|||„Curții Supreme de Justiție” || The Supreme Court quashed the 7 Feb 2019 appellate decision (20 Nov 2019). || The Supreme Court also quashed the 6 Aug 2018 first-instance judgment. || The Supreme Court remanded the case for re-trial to the Râșcani seat. || MoldTrans-Tur filed a recourse and requested acceleration; the SCJ set an admissibility hearing and denied acceleration. || Judge Diana Stănilă serves on special panels and has a heavy docket affecting scheduling. || The SCJ invokes ECHR Article 6(1) on reasonable time to justify scheduling. || The SCJ previously admitted the Metropolis’s recourse and remitted for re-trial (2017).
summary: CURTEA SUPREMĂ DE JUSTIȚIE is described in the available records as follows: Supreme Court of Justice that admitted a 2019 recurs, scheduled admissibility hearing, and ruled on acceleration.|||0.99|||„Curții Supreme de Justiție”. The Supreme Court quashed the 7 Feb 2019 appellate decision (20 Nov 2019). The Supreme Court also quashed the 6 Aug 2018 first-instance judgment. The Supreme Court remanded the case for re-trial to the Râșcani seat. MoldTrans-Tur filed a recourse and requested acceleration; the SCJ set an admissibility hearing and denied acceleration. Judge Diana Stănilă serves on special panels and has a heavy docket affecting scheduling. The SCJ invokes ECHR Article 6(1) on reasonable time to justify scheduling. The SCJ previously admitted the Metropolis’s recourse and remitted for re-trial
